column3: A. Total Jurisdictions in BCAT database
column5: C.  Jurisdictions in Hazard-prone Regions that have adopted Commercial Building Codes with Disaster-Resistant Provisions
column6: D.  Jurisdictions in Hazard-prone Regions that have adopted Residential Building Codes with Disaster-Resistant Provisions
column7: E.  Jurisdictions in Hazard-prone Regions that have adopted Commercial and Residential Building Codes with Disaster-Resistant Provisions
column8: E/A Ratio: Jurisdictions with Hazard-Resistant Commercial and Residential Codes to Jurisdictions in BCAT database
column9:
E/B Ratio:
Jurisdictions with Hazard-Resistant Commercial and Residential Codes to Jurisdictions with Hazard-prone Regions

column1: 1 signifies when resistant codes were upgraded from IBC/IRC 2003 to IBC/IRC 2006 and state code overrides were implemented
2 signifies when BCAT database was upgraded to minimize duplicative jurisdictional information
3 signifies when resistant codes were upgraded from IBC/IRC 2006 to IBC/IRC 2009, and when the number of acceptable code editions was reduced from 3 most recent to 2 most recent editions
4 signifies when BCAT database was upgraded to minimize duplicative jurisdictional information
5 signifies when BCAT database was upgraded to minimize duplicative jurisdictional information
6 signifies when BCAT database was upgraded from IBC/IRC 2009 to IBC/IRC 2015 as minimum code standards, and when the hazard was expanded to include Damaging Wind and Tornado hazards

7 signifies when BCAT database was upgraded from IBC/IRC 2015 to IBC/IRC 2018 as minimum code standards, and hazard risks were revised to be based on the 2021 IBC & IRC, and when seismic risk was expanded to include long-period response acceleration
8 signifies when BCAT database was upgraded from IBC/IRC 2018 to IBC/IRC 2021 as minimum code editions.
9 signifies when hazard risks were revised to be based on the 2021 IBC & IRC.
